page.title: 04INDUSTRY IN MOORSIDE
page.content: WE WENT TO VISIT A FACTORY CALLED DONCASTERS OF MOORSIDE. WHEN WE WENT THERE WE FOUND THAT IN 1778 WHEN IT OPENED IT USED TO BE A CARPET MILL. IT GOT ITS NAME BECAUSE IT USED TO BE OWNED BY DANIEL DONCASTER. THEN THE MILL CLOSED DOWN. IT WAS LEFT DISUSED FOR A LONG TIME. THEN IT CHANGED. A COMPANY CALLED INCO BOUGHT IT TO MAKE PARTS FOR SHIPS AND PLANES, IN PARTICULAR NUTS AND BOLTS. THEY SEND THE PARTS TO COUNTRIES SUCH AS INDIA, AUSTRALIA,NEW ZEALAND, SAUDI ARABIA, INDONESIA AND RUSSIA. THEY EMPLOY ABOUT 75 MEN. THE SMALLEST NUT THEY MAKE WOULD COST ABOUT A YEAR'S POCKET MONEY - FIFTY POUNDS.
